object.property: Quick Setup will allow you to quickly setup your computer to your liking, but you can skip this just by closing this window.
Quick Setup needs internet access to install updates, install software, and setup system repositories.
These repositories contain extra software including apps, games, codecs, and drivers.

This option installs RPMFusion (a third party repository full of software that risiOS/Fedora cannot ship), as well as installs proprietary codecs (needed to open some types of media files), and proprietary video drivers (NVIDIA only). This is recommended and only advised not to do if you are trying to avoid proprietary software on your system.
This option installs Flatpak and sets up the Flathub repository. This gives you a bigger selection of many types of apps including open source and proprietary apps and games alike.
Set max parallel downloads to 10 and enables "fastest mirror" in the package manager. This makes downloads faster on good internet, but slower on bad internet.

risiOS out of the box ships GNOME Web because it is light, private, respects user freedom, and has improved significantly in it's most recent 44 release. However, we are aware GNOME Web may not fit everyone's browser needs, so we recommend downloading an additional browser.
